result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendan J Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons to include but not limited to firearms. No contact with H.M. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.

Bond previously posted in the amount of $150 has been applied. Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Restitution in the amount of $1229.29 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 15% surcharge in the amount of $217.69 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.
Uncharged False Imprisonment charge dismissed and read in.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan J Lucas

records.addlTxt: CK#14027 Restitution paid in full to H.M.M. se

Case called @ 2:49 PM Defendant Brendan J Lucas in court.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Brendan J Lucas.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Uncharged False Imprisonment charge dismissed and read in. No statement by DE. Court orders:  S/W 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ H.M., Rest $1229.29 - previously paid, DE is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons to include but not limited to firearms, Costs to include the domestic abuse surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP,  DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given. Bond previously posted to be applied.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jerod Barkley appeared by phone with Brendan J Lucas.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Barkley requests another STC to sort out an issue with property. Atty Barkley does believe that this case may resolve. The Court will schedule a P/S hearing for an anticipated resolution.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 2:00 PM Defendant Brendan J Lucas appeared in court with Attorney Jerod Barkley. Attorney Dennis Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered. Court orders $150 Cash Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 02:35 pm.
Status conference on March 28, 2022 at 02:35 pm.
